intro: Syngonanthus weddellii, commonly known as the Weddell's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its small, clustered flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Syngonanthus weddellii is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
